newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ekran to clarify Bakun terms with ABB.
newsitem.headline: Ekran to clarify Bakun terms with ABB.

text.p: Ekran Bhd said on Thursday said it was seeking clarifications over the terms of a contract to build the Bakun hydroelectric dam from ABB Asea Brown Boveri.
"BHC (Bakun Hydroelectric Corp Bhd) is seeking clarification of some of the terms from ABB," an advisor to Ekran chairman Ting Pek Khiing told reporters at the company's headquarters.
Ekran, who was awarded the Bakun project, has given the $5.5 billion engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) contract to ABB and Brazil's Companhia Brasileria Projectos o Obras (CBPO).
BHC, in which Ekran has a 32 percent stake, is the operating company of the project.

The advisor, speaking to reporters on the sidelines of a meeting between Ekran and ABB Brown Boveri, said the companies will return at a later date to clarify some of the outstanding issues on the EPC contract.
"It's not something that can be resolved overnight," he said.
Malaysia's Deputy Prime Minister and Finance Minister Anwar Ibrahim had said last week that there were "major disagreements" over the terms of the agreement between Ekran and ABB Asea Brown Boveri.
Anwar had said the disagreements were over "major terms" of the EPC contract, and could lead to a delay in the hydroelectric project, scheduled for completion by 2003.
Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said on Tuesday there was no dispute in the project, only differing personal opinions.
